title: Microsoft is set to bring Xbox Game Pass to PC in 2019 | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Xbox Game
Pass](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Speaking in a recent earnings call (via[Game
Informer](https://www.gameinformer.com/2018/10/24/microsoft-announces-plans-
to-expand-game-pass-to-pc)), Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella confirmed the gaming
subscription service will debut on
**[**PC**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/best-gaming-pc-2018-2993099)
**next year.**

Currently available for the [Xbox
One](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/xbox-one-s) family of consoles,
[Game Pass](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/xbox-game-pass-2947834) grants
you access to a hefty library for games for £7.99/$9.99 a month, with a free
month for new members.

Not many details were revealed during the earnings call, but knowing that Game
Pass is coming to PC is a huge step for Microsoft’s [Play
Anywhere](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/xbox-play-anywhere-
games-2947173) ecosystem.

It remains unknown whether all titles available in the service, including
third-party offerings, will be available on the Microsoft Store on PC once the
service debuts.

We imagine first-party titles will be the major focus for Game Pass on PC, all
of which have begun to launch on the service alongside a traditional release.

It’s excellent value, allowing players to gain access to [Forza Horizon
4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/forza-horizon-4) and [Sea of
Thieves](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sea-of-thieves) at launch in
2018, with [Gears 5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/gears-of-
war-5-release-date-2949338) and [Crackdown
3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/crackdown-3) to do the same next
year.

To celebrate the Halloween season, a variety of titles have been introduced to
Xbox Game Pass including Hello Neighbour, Outlast 2 and a few other spooky
treats.
